intro: Calvoa integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved calvoa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves that are usually smooth and lack any serrations. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the rainy season. Calvoa integrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
